Who was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand?

verses.text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

similars.text: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud: for the Lord hath spoken.
But if ye will not hearken unto me, and will not do all these commandments;
But when the congregation is to be gathered together, ye shall blow, but ye shall not sound an alarm.
And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
Therefore thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

verses.text: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

similars.text: And again, the Lord God hath commanded that men should not murder; that they should not lie; that they should not steal; that they should not take the name of the Lord their God in vain; that they should not envy; that they should not have malice; that they should not contend one with another; that they should not commit whoredoms; and that they should do none of these things; for whoso doeth them shall perish.
Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;
O Lord, we delight not in the destruction of our fellow men; their souls are precious before thee;
Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men:
Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Thou shalt not be affrighted at them: for the Lord thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.
Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the fatherless; nor take a widow's raiment to pledge:
And in nothing doth man offend God, or against none is his wrath kindled, save those who confess not his hand in all things, and obey not his commandments.
And behold, ye shall meet together oft; and ye shall not forbid any man from coming unto you when ye shall meet together, but suffer them that they may come unto you and forbid them not;

verses.text: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.

similars.text: Now if a man owed another, and he would not pay that which he did owe, he was complained of to the judge; and the judge executed authority, and sent forth officers that the man should be brought before him; and he judged the man according to the law and the evidences which were brought against him, and thus the man was compelled to pay that which he owed, or be stripped, or be cast out from among the people as a thief and a robber.

Now it was those men who sought to destroy them, who were lawyers, who were hired or appointed by the people to administer the law at their times of trials, or at the trials of the crimes of the people before the judges.
If there be a controversy between men, and they come unto judgment, that the judges may judge them; then they shall justify the righteous, and condemn the wicked.
If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour's goods.
If any man trespass against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house:
When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.

And the princes of the Philistines were wroth with him; and the princes of the Philistines said unto him, Make this fellow return, that he may go again to his place which thou hast appointed him, and let him not go down with us to battle, lest in the battle he be an adversary to us: for wherewith should he reconcile himself unto his master? should it not be with the heads of these men?
For if ye throughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye throughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbour;
Let them importune at the feet of the judge;
And they that make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of naught.

verses.text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.

similars.text: And thus shall ye conduct in all things.
And, therefore, whatsoever you shall ask me to tell you by that means, that will I grant unto you, and you shall have knowledge concerning it.
But know this, it shall be given you what you shall ask; and as ye are appointed to the head, the spirits shall be subject unto you.
Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
And if thou obtainest more than that which would be for thy support, thou shalt give it into my storehouse, that all things may be done according to that which I have said.
Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
But if a man be just, and do that which is lawful and right,
And thus all things shall be made sure, according to the laws of the land.

And in case that any decision of these quorums is made in unrighteousness, it may be brought before a general assembly of the several quorums, which constitute the spiritual authorities of the church; otherwise there can be no appeal from their decision.
Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

verses.text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day's uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.

similars.text: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
Now we were desirous that he should tarry with us for this cause, that the Jews might not know concerning our flight into the wilderness, lest they should pursue us and destroy us.
Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

And if it cannot be otherwise, that the cause of thy people may not fail before thee may thine anger be kindled, and thine indignation fall upon them, that they may be wasted away, both root and branch, from under heaven;
Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, when men rose up against us:
Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
There are those who have sought occasion against him without cause;

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

similars.text: And it came to pass that when he had said these words he could say no more, and he gave up the ghost.
He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
And it came to pass, as he had made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground clave asunder that was under them:

Now when the people had said this, and withstood all his words, and reviled him, and spit upon him, and caused that he should be cast out of their city, he departed thence and took his journey towards the city which was called Aaron.
And moreover, I say unto you that I have caused that ye should assemble yourselves together, that I might declare unto you that I can no longer be your teacher, nor your king;
Behold, hath he commanded any that they should depart out of the synagogues, or out of the houses of worship? Behold, I say unto you, Nay.
And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.

And he answered and spake unto those that stood before him, saying, Take away the filthy garments from him. And unto him he said, Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee, and I will clothe thee with change of raiment.
And he said unto him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way.
And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand, and called that place Ramath-lehi.
